contextId.information: This is an exaggeration referring to the world they knew, which in their case would mean the Roman Empire. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
Here Paul exaggerates to add emphasis. AT: "I am not sure why I do some of the things that I do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: For what I do, I do not really understand

contextId.information: Paul exaggerates again to add emphasis. AT: "I do not always do what I want to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: what I want to do, I do not do

contextId.information: Here Paul speaks very generally. He does not mean that every person in Israel will be saved. You can translate this in an active form. AT: "Thus God will save many in Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Thus all Israel will be saved

contextId.information: Paul exaggerates here to emphasize his point. AT: "filled with sufficient knowledge to follow God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

Here Paul speaks in a general manner concerning the churches of Christ. AT: "The believers in all the churches in this area send their greetings to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: All the churches of Christ greet you
